newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL-IBM slips, ITT rises.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL-IBM slips, ITT rises.

text.p: Shares of International Business Machines Corp fell two points in pre-opening trading on Wednesday after two brokerage houses shaved profit forecasts for Big Blue.
After Merrill Lynch & Co and Salomon Brothers cut their 1997 estimates, citing the strong dollar, IBM moved to 142-3/4 from its Tuesday close of 144-3/4 on the New York Stock Exchange, traders said.

After ITT Corp rebuffed a $55 a share takeover offer from Hilton Hotels Corp as inadequate, its shares rose 7/8 to 56-7/8 from their Tuesday closing price of 56. Wall Street was apparently betting that the hotel giant might be able to fetch a higher bid, or increase its share price on its own.
In ITT's rejection, the company said that it is reviewing its options to increase shareholder value and that it will try to block the Hilton offer in court.
Other early rising stocks were Oracle Corp and Applied Materials Inc.
Applied Materials jumped to 49-7/8 in early trading. It closed at 45-1/8 on the Nasdaq on Tuesday and posted first quarter earnings before charges of $0.48 a share.

Oracle shares rose to 40, from their closing price of 39-1/8, after chief financial officer Jeff Henley said the third quarter "looks good" and predicted that business in Europe would begin rebounding.
